title: Li K Emission Spectra Obtained using a New Diffraction Grating with Enhanced Diffraction Efficiency and Widen Energy Range
content: Recently, the great demand of chemical state analysis of bulk materials using a scanning electron microscope (SEM) or electron probe microanalyzer (EPMA) has occurred in various research fields. e.g., batteries, steels, and polymer materials. To meet with these demands, Terauchi et al. developed a soft X-ray emission spectrometer (SXES) equipped with varied-line-spacing diffraction grating and they demonstrated high energy resolution with SXES combined with a transmission electron microscope [1,2]. Based on their work, JEOL Ltd. have commercialized a soft X-ray emission spectrometer (SXES) which can be installed in general-purpose SEM/EPMA in 2013 [3]. This instrument has been contributed to the popularization of chemical state analysis of various bulk samples including practical samples containing Li utilized in the second batteries [4]. However, the limitation of energy range of the current SXES (JEOL SS-94000SXES) with the JS50XL grating [5] prevented the observation of spectra in lower energy than 50 eV and it regarded as a bottleneck to chemical state analysis of lithium compounds, especially for lithium oxides for their larger chemical shift.
